comment.author: 92149915@N08
comment._content: According to an entry at the Commonwealth War Graves Commission Charles was the son of James & Alicia Allan of Gorton House, Hawthornden, Midlothian.

comment.author: 69679868@N03
comment._content: There is an excellent account of the acrtions of 1/4 Royal Scots at Gallipoli at www.scarboroughsmaritimeheritage.org.uk/greatwar/f13-gall... . On 28th June 1915 - 22 out of 30 officers were reported (on 2Jul 15) killed, wounded or missing.//

comment.author: 64288588@N05
comment._content:
In 1891 he was listed in the census as being 11 months old and the first child of his parents, James and Alicia. They were then living at 1 Cambridge Street, Edinburgh St Cuthberts.

Database of UK Soliders Killed in the Great War lists him as a Lieutenant in Royal Scots (Lothian Regiment) 4th Battalion (Queens Edinburgh Rifles) (Territorial)

comment.author: 8211710@N08
comment._content: Charles Allan was my Great Uncle
